histogram.name: SharedHighlights.AndroidShareSheet.SharedState
histogram.summary: Records the status of the link generation when a user shares content using the feature on Android.

histogram.name: SharedHighlights.AsyncTask.Iterations
histogram.summary: Indicates number of iterations it took for AsyncFindBuffer to finish the search. AsyncFindBuffer is used only for validating generated text fragment selectors for Shared Highlighting.

histogram.name: SharedHighlights.AsyncTask.SearchDuration
histogram.summary: Time it took in milliseconds for AsyncFindBuffer to finish the search. AsyncFindBuffer is used only for validating generated text fragment selectors for Shared Highlighting.

histogram.name: SharedHighlights.Desktop.CopiedLinkType
histogram.summary: Records the type of shared highlighting link the user copied on desktop.

histogram.name: SharedHighlights.LinkGenerated.Error
histogram.summary: Records errors that caused text fragment selector generation to fail. Recorded for all the failed link generation runs. This histogram is a superset of |SharedHighlights.LinkGenerated.Error.Requested|.

histogram.name: SharedHighlights.LinkGenerated.Error.Iterations
histogram.summary: Indicates number of iterations it took for the unsuccessful text fragment selector generation run.

histogram.name: SharedHighlights.LinkGenerated.Error.Requested
histogram.summary: Records errors that caused text fragment selector generation to fail. Recorded only for failure cases that were requested by users.

histogram.name: SharedHighlights.LinkGenerated.Error.TimeToGenerate
histogram.summary: Time it took in millisecons for a failed text fragment selector generation attempt.

histogram.name: SharedHighlights.LinkGenerated.Iterations
histogram.summary: Indicates number of iterations it took to successfully generate text fragment selector.

histogram.name: SharedHighlights.LinkGenerated.ParamLength
histogram.summary: Number of charaters in successfully generated text fragment selector. For example, for #:=:text=sample%20text, it would be the len("sample%20text") which is 13. Recorded only when selector generation was successful.

histogram.name: SharedHighlights.LinkGenerated.SelectionLength
histogram.summary: Number of characters in the user selected text, that text fragment selector is generated for. Recorded regardless of generation success.

histogram.name: SharedHighlights.LinkGenerated.SelectorParameters
histogram.summary: Indicates which parameters were specified in a text fragment selector. Recorded only when selector generation was successful.

histogram.name: SharedHighlights.LinkGenerated.StateAtRequest
histogram.summary: Records the state of the link generation when link to text request is received from the browser process.

histogram.name: SharedHighlights.LinkGenerated.TimeToGenerate
histogram.summary: How long it took in milliseconds to successfully generate text fragment selector.

histogram.name: SharedHighlights.LinkGenerated{Requested}
histogram.summary: Indicates whether text fragment selector generation was successful for {Requested}.

variant.name: .Requested

variant.name: .RequestedAfterReady
variant.summary: cases when selector is requested after its ready.

variant.name: .RequestedBeforeReady

histogram.name: SharedHighlights.LinkToTextDiagnoseStatus
histogram.summary: Records the status of link to text flow on Android for diagnostic purposes. Intended to be temporary for debug purposes.

histogram.name: SharedHighlights.ObtainReshareLink.Status
histogram.summary: Records if obtaining reshare link was successful. Otherwise, it records the failure reason.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor.ElementIdFragmentFound
histogram.summary: Whether an element-id based fragment was found in the document. Counted only when a fragment was specified and it wasn't parsed into a |targetText| style anchor.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor.LinkOpenSource
histogram.summary: Recorded for every navigation to a link with a valid text fragment selector (e.g. #:=:text=SELECTOR). Indicates source type that navigation originated from. It only know about search engines that come from the pre-populated list installed with Chrome. If the user uses a search engine not on the list, it will be recorded as Unknown. This is even true if the user have a custom search engine. These custom search engines can be created by hand or auto-generated. In either case, it's not going to count as a search engine. Also, it only checks to see if the *referrer* is from a domain associated with search engine. If someone posts a link somewhere on a web site that happens to have a search engine known to Google and that links includes the fragment tokens, then if a user clicks that link, it'll look like it came from a search engine even thought they did not.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.AmbiguousMatch
histogram.summary:
Whether we found multiple matches for a selector. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.DidScrollIntoView
histogram.summary:
Whether the page did a non-zero scroll in order to scroll the match into view. Only recorded if we found a match and scrolled it into view. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.DirectiveLength
histogram.summary:
The raw length of the directive in the URL (e.g. spaces count as the three characters '%20'), regardless of how many text= terms there are. Recorded if there was a text directive, regardless of whether a match was found. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.EndTextLength
histogram.summary:
The length of the end parameter, in the case of a range match. Only recorded if a match was found. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.ExactTextLength
histogram.summary:
The length of the matched text, in the case of an exact match. Only recorded if a match was found. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.ListItemMatch
histogram.summary:
Whether the match was within a list item. Only recorded for exact text fragments and only if a match was found. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.MatchRate
histogram.summary:
The percentage of selectors for which a match was found in the document. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.Parameters
histogram.summary:
An enum indicating which parameters were specified in the text fragment anchor. Only recorded if a match was found. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.RangeMatchLength
histogram.summary:
The length of the matched text, in the case of a range match. Only recorded if a match was found. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.ScrollCancelled
histogram.summary:
Whether the scroll into view was cancelled by a user gesture or programmatic scroll. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.SelectorCount
histogram.summary:
The number of selectors in the text fragment anchor if it is present. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.SpansMultipleBlocks
histogram.summary:
Whether or not a range-based text fragment match crosses any block boundaries. That is, the start and end of the range are in different blocks or in the same block but contain an intervening block. Only recorded for range-based (start,end) text fragments. Only recorded on successful match.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.StartTextLength
histogram.summary:
The length of the start parameter, in the case of a range match. Only recorded if a match was found. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.TableCellMatch
histogram.summary:
Whether the match was within a table cell. Only recorded for exact text fragments and only if a match was found. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.TimeToScrollIntoView
histogram.summary:
The time between creating the TextFragmentAnchor (i.e. when it is parsed) and scrolling the target into view. Only recorded if there is a match and we tried to scroll it into view (it may already have been in view). Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.TimeToScrollToTop
histogram.summary:
The time between scrolling a match into view and the user scrolling back to the top of the page. Used as a signal for whether a match was useful. Only recorded if a match is scrolled into view and the user subsequently scrolled back to the top of the page. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.
